chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant John Arthur J. CLARK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Reminder Notice - Final Notice
Notice of Intent
Notice of Case Status Change from DOC indicating defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to county jail effective 03-28-2016

Defendant in custody on WRIT.
The defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for eight (8) mnths, under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.  Court authorizes transfer to Brown County Jail.  Huber is to include release for medical treatment, if a plan is in place for defendant's psychological needs.  
Defendant has credit for 49 days.
Unpaid court costs are converted to a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt:
The State files an Amended Information which charges two counts of 4th degree sexual assault, contrary to Section 940.225(3m) of the Wisconsin Statutes.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1. Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in count 2.  Motion granted.
Sentence Withheld.  Defendant is placed on probation to DOC for eighteen (18) months.
Conditions of probation:
1) Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Departments assessment process;
2) Pay court costs;
3) pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by DOC;
4) maintain fulltime employment, schooling or combination at the agents discretion;
5) no contact with M.R.C. and P.E.C. or their family, except as allowed by the agent.
Amended Information.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Victim Impact Statement.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Minutes.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 07-25-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Plea date is set for 09-03-14 at 11:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Preliminary Hearing scheduled for 06-20-2014 @ 9:30 a.m. BR-3.
Rescheduled from 6-17-2014.
Jewel Scharenbroch, Public Defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 06-17-14 at 2:30 p.m.
Minutes.
Defendant states he has an appointment with his counsel this week.  Initial appearance is reset to 06-09-14 at 2:30 p.m.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 06-02-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with P.E.C., DOB: 11-18-1998 or M.R.C., DOB: 04-03-2001 and no unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18.  Bail furnished.
